item.title: PPMS Monitor and Control v1.9.2.22
item.description:
Product: PPMS Monitor and Control v1.9.2.22
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Wed, 21 May 2025 20:21:10 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Monitor and Control application inheritng from Instrument Framework and SMO
- Log instrument status to the PGSQL database.
- UI and API for controlling magnet field, temperature, and rotator angle (PPMS2 only)

Release Notes: [1.9.2]
- #33 and #34: Fixes issues with API methods
- Update to latest Instrument Framework and Cryostat Interface
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Multichannel Lockin v2.20.2.11
item.description:
Product: Multichannel Lockin v2.20.2.11
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Wed, 21 May 2025 19:03:41 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: Multichannel Lockin for National Instruments' Dynamic Signal Acquisition hardware (4431, 4461, 4462).
- This version is configured to handle multiple cards for simultaneous, synchronized AI/AO.
- The analog outputs can be configured to output sine, square, sawtooth, or triangle functions with (swept) DC offsets.
- Each of the analog inputs can be demodulated at multiple frequencies.

Release Notes: [2.20.2]
Issues:
#97 Fix IDN query
#98: Disable logging if device array is not initialized or data arrays are empty
#99: API methods that use parent API overrides should also use parent typedefs

#### Dependencies
- Please ensure that [Visual C++ Redistributable Packages for Visual Studio 2013](https://www.microsoft.com/en-us/download/details.aspx?id=40784) is installed. The bitness must match the application you're targeting.
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.15.4.39
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.15.4.39
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Wed, 21 May 2025 16:28:37 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh.

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Framework for communicating with hardware (Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either NI's Simple Messaging Library (STM) (deprecated in v1.9) or cross-platform protocol ZMQ (preferred beginning with v1.9))
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

Release Notes: [1.15.4]
#172 fixes an issue with the default configuration window not correctly saving the hardware address
item.dc:creator: LevyLab

item.title: Control Experiment v1.2.1.12
item.description:
Product: Control Experiment v1.2.1.12
Company: Levylab
Release Date: Wed, 21 May 2025 08:52:33 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: VIs for scripting and performing transport measurments.

[Control Experiment.lvclass]
- Control Experiment.vi
- provides a uniform way to record information about your sample & device
- record how the lockin is connected to the device
- configure the Krohn Hite amplifier
- set the base path for saving data
- configure peripheral instruments
- APIs for recording sample data, instrument status

Release Notes: [1.2.1]
#96: Add new instruments (OptiCool, eLine, Omicron)
#97: Improve dynamic load instrument classes
#98: fix Krohn Hite channel enumeration
#99: bugfix to preserve runtime value of instrument type
#101: save and recall number of AI channels
item.dc:creator: Levylab

item.title: Instrument Framework v1.15.3.38
item.description:
Product: Instrument Framework v1.15.3.38
Company: LevyLab
Release Date: Mon, 19 May 2025 16:07:14 -0400
Packager: Patrick Irvin

Description: An object-oriented framework based on JKI SMOs, developed by the LevyLab at the University of Pittsburgh.

An Instrument developed using this framework will have the access to the following capabilities:

- Framework for communicating with hardware (Hardware Abstraction Layer (HAL))
- Periodically polls the instrument for its settings and logs them to a PGSQL database
- Defines an API to allow external programs to control compiled instances of the application and remotely across a network (Either NI's Simple Messaging Library (STM) (deprecated in v1.9) or cross-platform protocol ZMQ (preferred beginning with v1.9))
- Provide a user interface (optional but probably desirable).
- Methods for reading and writing configuration from disk.

Release Notes: [1.15.1]
#168 Fixes an issue when HELP does not include an argument (HELP "")
item.dc:creator: LevyLab
